channel.title: attack.t1105 on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.t1105 on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Download a File with IMEWDBLD.exe
item.description: Use IMEWDBLD.exe (built-in to windows) to download a file

item.title: Suspicious Minimized MSEdge Start
item.description: Detects the suspicious minimized start of MsEdge browser, which can be used to download files from the Internet

item.title: Suspicious Diantz Download and Compress Into a CAB File
item.description: Download and compress a remote file and store it in a cab file on local machine.

item.title: AppInstaller Attempts From URL by DNS
item.description: AppInstaller.exe is spawned by the default handler for the URI, it attempts to load/install a package from the URL

item.title: Suspicious Certreq Command to Download
item.description: Detects a suspicious certreq execution taken from the LOLBAS examples, which can be abused to download (small) files

item.title: Remote File Copy
item.description: Detects the use of tools that copy files from or to remote systems

item.title: PowerShell DownloadFile
item.description: Detects the execution of powershell, a WebClient object creation and the invocation of DownloadFile in a single command line

item.title: Curl Start Combination
item.description: Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.

item.title: Cisco Stage Data
item.description: Various protocols maybe used to put data on the device for exfil or infil

item.title: Malicious Payload Download via Office Binaries
item.description: Downloads payload from remote server

item.title: Command Line Execution with Suspicious URL and AppData Strings
item.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that includes an URL and AppData string in the command line parameters as used by several droppers (js/vbs > powershell)

item.title: MsiExec Web Install
item.description: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts with web addresses as parameter

item.title: Suspicious Certutil Command
item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft certutil execution with sub commands like ‘decode’ sub command, which is sometimes used to decode malicious code with the built-in certutil utility

item.title: Microsoft Binary Github Communication
item.description: Detects an executable in the Windows folder accessing github.com

item.title: Microsoft Binary Suspicious Communication Endpoint
item.description: Detects an executable in the Windows folder accessing suspicious domains

item.title: Download from Suspicious Dyndns Hosts
item.description: Detects download of certain file types from hosts with dynamic DNS names (selected list)

item.title: File Download with Headless Browser
item.description: This is an unusual method to download files. It starts a browser headless and downloads a file from a location. This can be used by threat actors to download files.

item.title: Finger.exe Suspicious Invocation
item.description: Detects suspicious aged finger.exe tool execution often used in malware attacks nowadays

item.title: GfxDownloadWrapper.exe Downloads File from Suspicious URL
item.description: Detects when GfxDownloadWrapper.exe downloads file from non standard URL

item.title: Greenbug Campaign Indicators
item.description: Detects tools and process executions as observed in a Greenbug campaign in May 2020

item.title: Pandemic Registry Key
item.description: Detects Pandemic Windows Implant

item.title: Suspicious Curl File Upload
item.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start the adds a file to a web request

item.title: Suspicious Curl Usage on Windows
item.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file

item.title: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Command
item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr execution with parameters used to download files from the Internet

item.title: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Target File
item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr file creation that stores a file to a suspicious location or contains a file with a suspicious extension

item.title: Suspicious Replace.exe Execution
item.description: Replace.exe is used to replace file with another file

item.title: Windows Update Client LOLBIN
item.description: Detects code execution via the Windows Update client (wuauclt)
